1354844543410176005.text:
Fran’s family offers thanks for the compassionate care provided by her medical staff and healthcare workers whose efforts filled her life with dignity and hope.

May she Rest In Peace.

1354844253017534469.text: There were great demands for her delicious pierogi, lasagna, babka bread, and lemon meringue pie. Frances was an avid lover of animals including her own Victor and Vanessa.

1354844210424389635.text:
Frances had been recognized in the past by former Governor Mario Cuomo as “New York Blood Donor of the Year”. 

She took great pride in her vegetable and flower gardens. She was a great baker and cook.

1354844042849357831.text: Frances was a lifelong Greater Amsterdam area resident. She was a member of St. Stanislaus Church and the Ladies Rosary Society; St. Mary’s Club 60 and a past member of the Montgomery County Women’s Democratic Club. She was appreciated as an energetic campaigner.

1354843933369634820.text: Frances had been employed by the Selective Service System and later worked for the Amsterdam Insurance Agency in Amsterdam, NY until her retirement in 1976.

1354843851819790337.text: On June 21, 1947, she was united in marriage to Stanley C. Tonko. They shared 68 years of married life together. Stanley died on June 28, 2015.

1354843739487932417.text: Frances was born on April 16, 1921. She was the daughter of Boleslaw and Karolyna Bik Grajewski. She was a 1937 Wilbur H. Lynch High School graduate. She later continued her Post Graduate studies.

1354843564442865666.text: Frances G. Tonko, 99, of Princeton Street, Amsterdam, NY died very peacefully on Sunday, January 24, 2021, at the River Ridge Living Center in Amsterdam, New York. https://t.co/O4b8PxF6gB

1353772372961226753.text: Congressman Tonko’s mother Fran passed away late last night. The Tonko family is grateful to everyone who has offered prayers and messages of warmth and support at this difficult time. We ask for patience and privacy as they grieve. -Staff

1309190173578665984.text:
Let’s deliver the financial support our essential workers, unemployed workers, and financially strained Americans need to weather this storm. 

The Heroes Act gets it done.

1309190172114923520.text:
Let’s save lives and turn the corner on this crisis with a coordinated national plan for testing and tracing. 

The Heroes Act gets it done.

1309190170311352321.text:
Let’s deliver emergency funding to sustain local essential services and the salaries of first responders, nurses, teachers, infrastructure maintenance workers, and many more. 

The Heroes Act gets that done too.

1309190168822321154.text:
We have a plan. Join us.

Let’s invest heavily in research and follow science and public health guidance. They are the fastest route to get us to the other side of this crisis.

Our Heroes Act gets it done.

But if the House and Senate bring the same spirit of unity & resilience to our work that the American people have shown throughout this crisis, The Heroes Act will be signed into law quickly and its urgent assistance will reach the people who need it most.

/end

1260668704939036679.text: There’s work to be done here to deliver our smart and timely crisis aid package to the American people. Just as we did before with the CARES Act, this will take a bipartisan effort and the President’s signature to make it happen.

1260668623846346776.text: - Elimination of the harmful and deeply unfair State and Local Tax (SALT) deduction limitation for Tax Years 2020 and 2021

1260668511883530242.text: - Billions invested in critical systems including specific funding for primary and higher education, community health centers, emergency services, hospitals and other providers, Medicaid, highway infrastructure, biomedical research and much more.

1260668039957184518.text: - Support for small businesses by strengthening the Payroll Protection Program to (1) make sure it can reach underserved communities & diverse nonprofits, and (2) is flexible by providing $10 billion for COVID-19 emergency grants through the Economic Injury Disaster Loan program.

1260667643725582338.text: - Money in the pockets of workers with a second round of direct payments to families up to $6,000 per household, new payroll protection measures to keep 60 million workers connected with their jobs and extending weekly $600 federal unemployment payments through next January.

1260667579934408705.text: - An additional $75 billion for the testing, tracing and treatment we need in order to have a science-based path to safely reopen our country and helping ensure that every American can access free #coronavirus treatment.

1260667461483089928.text:
Here are just a few of the other things the Heroes Act includes to help struggling families and communities: 

- Strong support for our heroes through establishing a $200 billion Heroes’ fund to ensure that essential workers across the country receive hazard pay.

1260667136818712583.text: These folks have kept our communities going under challenging circumstances and they need to know we have their backs. Our legislation delivers that assurance and puts our communities on a more solid footing to weather this storm.

1260667010691796997.text: These and other measures in the bill are important steps if we want to ensure our state and local officials can keep local firefighters, teachers, nurses and other essential workers on the job at this critical time—and it should go without saying that we do.

1225231566462423042.text: My heartfelt condolences to Kirk’s family and all who knew and loved him. May his spirit rest forever in peace. #RIP

1225231385914413058.text: His humble beginnings were a statement of the uniquely American dream that touched many of our immigrant ancestors, and his life of service was a testament to the deep humanitarian spirit of our hometown.

1225231309762703361.text: Kirk’s enduring connection with Amsterdam gave us a sense of pride and faith to know the kid next door could make it in the bright lights of Hollywood.

1225231144754581504.text: Kirk’s name is memorably emblazoned on the deck of our iconic Mohawk Valley Gateway Overlook as a reminder of his roots, his strength and the values and spirit of community that can come from growing up in the Mohawk Valley.

1225230973501087745.text: Kirk started his great career on the stage of Amsterdam High School and today he is immortalized in places throughout our city.

1225230644260884481.text: I will always treasure the memory of marching in the streets of Amsterdam as a young assemblyman next to Kirk Douglas and Governor Mario Cuomo for our city’s 200th anniversary parade.

1225230567463145475.text: Kirk Douglas was many things to many fans, but to the people of Amsterdam he was a reminder that even small towns can produce great legends.

1225230479735054338.text: All of Amsterdam, New York mourns the news that the lifelong winning performance of our favorite celebrity son Kirk Douglas has come to an end.

1186727134804488192.text: @ClimateCrisis @USRepKCastor @ArcticPermafrst Hard to overstate the impact here. At the low end, this means Arctic permafrost melt could be adding the equivalent of the entire emissions of New York State to the atmosphere, every year until 2100. Hundreds of millions of cars worth of carbon. We must #ActOnClimate now. https://t.co/rjUrqekgro

1186724812674273280.text: @ClimateCrisis @USRepKCastor @ArcticPermafrst These new Winter Arctic emissions are a new discovery being tracked by these researchers. That means these are emissions that have not been factored into IPCC and other global climate projections so far. https://t.co/rsc2zMUPZk

1186723654148726784.text: @ClimateCrisis @USRepKCastor @ArcticPermafrst This powerful research shows us that warming permafrost is now causing increased microbial activity in the WINTER, a new development that is dramatically increasing emissions. This could mean the release of up to 27 BILLION TONS of carbon into the atmosphere by 2100. https://t.co/M3C1jryMpH

1186722620273762305.text: @ClimateCrisis @USRepKCastor @ArcticPermafrst Releasing that carbon will significantly increase the total greenhouse gas in Earth's atmosphere, which will further warm the Earth, thaw more permafrost, release more carbon, and on and on. https://t.co/IhQkr4twCk

1186722028323254272.text: @ClimateCrisis @USRepKCastor @ArcticPermafrst Right now, there is 2x as much readily-available carbon in cold and frozen arctic soils (a.k.a. permafrost) as there is in the entire Earth’s atmosphere. 1180876355463974913.text: The first anniversary of any tragedy brings a painful renewal of grief and loss. 1180876154997297153.text: Their faces and voices that night of the first vigil have stayed with me. Thousands had converged to remember the lost, to stand with their friends and loved ones in painful solidarity, to grieve together.

1131232575626895361.text: Transportation is now the #1 source of greenhouse gas emissions in the U.S. Our work to #ActOnClimate will fall short unless we help build infrastructure for cleaner vehicles. #LIFTAmerica has major funding for transportation electrification & electric vehicle charging stations!

1131230030477053953.text: We need to make sure every neighborhood & community can benefit from our investments in clean energy deployment. #LIFTAmerica includes $2.25 billion over 5 yrs to create new grant support for distributed energy systems & solar installations in low-income & underserved communities

1131229300840128519.text: We also know America’s energy grid is critical security infrastructure that faces threats including increasingly frequent and severe extreme weather events. A more resilient grid will keep us safer and help our communities better withstand these events.

1131228796143710208.text: #LIFTAmerica includes $4 billion over five years for electric grid infrastructure, including grid modernization & resilience upgrades. A smarter grid makes it easier for us to integrate renewable energy resources and superior demand response programs.

1131228103341150208.text: America’s Weatherization Assistance Program makes small but meaningful investments to get homes in better, more efficient condition. @ENERGY estimates an average annual savings of $283 per home from this cost-effective program!

1131221954596356096.text: My bill to reauthorize and modernize @ENERGY’s Weatherization Assistance Program (H.R. 2041) is part of #LIFTAmerica. This program has helped more than 7.4 million low-income households make their homes healthier, safer, and more efficient. https://t.co/B3PECajRGU

1131216857501974528.text: #LIFTAmerica invests billions in energy efficiency including building retrofits. Buildings consume ~40% of total US energy demand. 976940185387716608.text: @NTIAgov I also co-chair the Heritage Area Caucus and am pleased that we were able to secure $500,000 increase for Heritage Partnership Programs. Thanks to innovative public-private partnerships, each dollar we spend attracts an average of $5.50 in additional private funding.

976939910144909313.text: @NTIAgov Historic sites & cultural centers instill in us a sense of place. They can also be important economic drivers: America’s museums spend $21 billion in their communities every year & employ 400,000 Americans. We secured $3 million under this deal for the Office of Museum Services.

976939576383156225.text: Broadband Internet has gone from a luxury to an economic necessity. Our Capital Region still has homes & businesses without this access. We worked to secure an additional $2.1 billion to expand rural broadband access and $7.5 million for @NTIAgov to improve its broadband maps.

976930257658875904.text: The Weatherization Assistance Program (WAP) helps low-income Americans improve the energy-efficiency of their homes. Democrats fought to secure $248 million for the #weatherization program, another one the President attempted to eliminate.

976930031095177216.text: That's in addition to securing $47 million more for the Department of Energy Advanced Research Projects Agency-Energy (ARPA-E), a major source of cutting-edge U.S. energy research.

976929991740010497.text: America’s competitors around the world are spending heavily on clean energy, and we are barely keeping up. Disregarding the President’s requested cuts, we were able to add $231 million to the Department of Energy Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy (EERE).

976929957212573697.text: @EPA @CDCgov Foreign interference in the 2016 election is well-documented, despite many denials by President Trump. Thankfully the President’s opinions had little to do with the outcome here, which yielded $380 million in new funding to help states protect election systems from cyber threats.

976929927437193219.text: @EPA This budget deal loosens the gag on @CDCgov #gunviolence research, opening a door that has been closed for more than two decades. The bill also strengthens the background check system and helps cash-strapped school systems looking to invest in greater #schoolsafety & security.

976929892393783298.text: Thanks to Democrats, President Trump got none of his desired cuts to @EPA. Staff members at this agency work tirelessly every day to ensure pollution and contaminants can be kept out of the water we drink, the air we breathe and the soil that helps grow the food on our tables.

976929846210301953.text: 86% of U.S. households depend on public water systems, many of which need major repairs or replacement. My colleagues and I secured $300 million in additional funding for states to repair drinking water systems & $300 million more to support state-run clean water programs.

976915889777008642.text: We also secured $1.6b for Community Health Centers on the front lines of the #OpioidCrisis. And despite the President's proposal to cut them, Substance Abuse Prevention and Treatment grants will continue to deliver lifesaving treatment to some 1.5 million individuals every year.

976915365845454853.text: As America’s #opioidcrisis continues to worsen, the need for a national response becomes ever more urgent. I am proud to report that my Democratic colleagues and I were able to secure $3.2 billion for programs that specifically address the #OpioidEpidemic.

976915250518855682.text: This bipartisan budget agreement include dozens and dozens of critical wins in other vitally important areas that will help millions of Americans. Many were opposed by President Trump and Republican leaders. They are included largely because I and other Democrats fought for them.

976914275590602752.text: We still have a tremendous amount of work to do on these and other related issues, including securing universal background checks on all firearm sales and protections for undocumented individuals who were brought to America as children and now face deportation by this President.

976914218929836032.text: Overall, the other priorities represented in this bill will help millions of Americans who are still being largely ignored and forgotten by this President and Republican leaders in Congress.

976914178219835393.text: ...this bill avoids foolish, costly and unpopular spending on a border wall and other misguided priorities that would do little to address the major issues with our border or our immigration system.

976914129595314177.text: While I remain deeply concerned by blockbuster military spending increases and broader budgetary issues less than a year after Republicans voted to add some $2 trillion to the deficit to give tax breaks to the wealthy...

976914041871454209.text: ...and critical funding for proven safety net programs such as Head Start, home #weatherization, community #health centers, #manufacturing growth, heritage areas, #museums and #libraries, and much more.

976913843954814976.text: ...support for states to make urgent drinking water repairs and upgrades, mental health treatment and training, advances in clean energy research, improvements to our broadband Internet maps and America’s transportation systems...

976913764283973632.text: Today’s bipartisan budget agreement reflects major priorities that my Democratic colleagues and I have been actively pushing for months to achieve, including major steps forward in combating the #OpioidEpidemic, addressing gun violence research...

974681009181659142.text: Working with Louise taught me a great deal about how to be a better public servant and I will forever miss our countless conversations and her warm and wise counsel.

974680931775778816.text: Louise touched the lives of many with the warmth of her smile and sweet sound of her Kentucky accent. Her determination to fight for the people of New York & our nation will long be a shining example for aspiring young women and all Americans of good conscience & selfless heart.

974680797377712128.text: When she spoke it was with conviction, charm, intellect, integrity, and a force that felt at times like it would raise the Capitol dome.

974680703391674369.text: Louise was beloved by many for her lifetime of service to the people of Rochester. Her fierce and principled leadership as the dean of our New York delegation and as the first woman ever to chair the House Rules Committee elevated our work in Congress every single day.

- What is Pruitt doing in his $40,000 custom sound-proof booth that he couldn't do in the one EPA already had?
- Why are taxpayers paying so much for his travel?
- Why is he hiding so much of this activity from Congress & the American people?

974301377601179656.text: Amidst this lavish spending on travel and office upgrades for the agency's Administrator Scott Pruitt, EPA is facing massive cuts to career staff and programs that are critical to helping state and local governments safeguard public health and the environment.
